00025 #include "lpc17xx_i2c.h"
00026 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00027 #include "lpc17xx_pinsel.h"
00028 #include "debug_frmwrk.h"
00029 
00030 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00036 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS *************************/
00038 #define USEDI2CDEV_S            0
00039 
00040 #define I2CDEV_S_OWN_ADDR       (0x90>>1)
00041 
00043 #define BUFFER_SIZE                     0x10
00044 
00045 #if (USEDI2CDEV_S == 0)
00046 #define I2CDEV_S LPC_I2C0
00047 #elif (USEDI2CDEV_S == 2)
00048 #define I2CDEV_S LPC_I2C2
00049 #else
00050 #error "Slave I2C device not defined!"
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00054 uint8_t menu1[] =
00055 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00056 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00057 "I2C demo \n\r"
00058 "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00059 "\t - Core: ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r"
00060 "\t - This example uses I2C as slave device to transfer data \n\r"
00061 " to/from I2C master device \n\r"
00062 "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00063 
00065 uint8_t Slave_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00066 uint8_t slave_test[2];
00067 
00068 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTIONS *************************/
00069 void print_menu(void);
00070 void Buffer_Init(uint8_t type);
00071 
00072 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00073 /*********************************************************************/
00078 void print_menu(void)
00079 {
00080         _DBG_(menu1);
00081 }
00082 
00083 /*********************************************************************/
00093 void Buffer_Init(uint8_t type)
00094 {
00095         uint8_t i;
00096 
00097         if (type)
00098         {
00099                 for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++) {
00100                         Slave_Buf[i] = i;
00101                 }
00102         }
00103         else
00104         {
00105                 for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++) {
00106                         Slave_Buf[i] = 0;
00107                 }
00108         }
00109 }
00110 
00111 
00112 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00113 /*********************************************************************/
00118 int c_entry(void)
00119 {
00120         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00121         I2C_OWNSLAVEADDR_CFG_Type OwnSlavAdr;
00122         I2C_S_SETUP_Type transferSCfg;
00123         uint32_t tempp;
00124         uint8_t *pdat;
00125 
00126         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00127          * – 115200bps
00128          * – 8 data bit
00129          * – No parity
00130          * – 1 stop bit
00131          * – No flow control
00132          */
00133         debug_frmwrk_init();
00134 
00135         print_menu();
00136 
00137         /* I2C block ------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00138 
00139         /*
00140          * Init I2C pin connect
00141          */
00142         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00143         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00144 #if ((USEDI2CDEV_S == 0))
00145         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00146         PinCfg.Pinnum = 27;
00147         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00148         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00149         PinCfg.Pinnum = 28;
00150         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00151 #endif
00152 #if ((USEDI2CDEV_S == 2))
00153         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00154         PinCfg.Pinnum = 10;
00155         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00156         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00157         PinCfg.Pinnum = 11;
00158         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00159 #endif
00160 
00161         // Initialize Slave I2C peripheral
00162         I2C_Init(I2CDEV_S, 100000);
00163 
00164         /* Set  Own slave address for I2C device */
00165         OwnSlavAdr.GeneralCallState = ENABLE;
00166         OwnSlavAdr.SlaveAddrChannel= 0;
00167         OwnSlavAdr.SlaveAddrMaskValue = 0xFF;
00168         OwnSlavAdr.SlaveAddr_7bit = I2CDEV_S_OWN_ADDR;
00169         I2C_SetOwnSlaveAddr(I2CDEV_S, &OwnSlavAdr);
00170 
00171         /* Enable Slave I2C operation */
00172         I2C_Cmd(I2CDEV_S, ENABLE);
00173 
00174         _DBG_("Press '1' to start");
00175         while (_DG != '1');
00176 
00177 
00178         /* Reading -------------------------------------------------------- */
00179         _DBG_("Start Reading...");
00180 
00181         /* Initialize buffer */
00182         Buffer_Init(0);
00183 
00184         /* Start I2C slave device first */
00185         transferSCfg.tx_data = NULL;
00186         transferSCfg.tx_length = 0;
00187         transferSCfg.rx_data = Slave_Buf;
00188         transferSCfg.rx_length = sizeof(Slave_Buf);
00189         I2C_SlaveTransferData(I2CDEV_S, &transferSCfg, I2C_TRANSFER_POLLING);
00190 
00191         pdat = Slave_Buf;
00192         // Verify
00193         for (tempp = 0; tempp < sizeof(Slave_Buf); tempp++){
00194                 if (*pdat++ != tempp){
00195                         _DBG_("Verify error");
00196                         break;
00197                 }
00198         }
00199         if (tempp == sizeof(Slave_Buf)){
00200                 _DBG_("Verify successfully");
00201         }
00202 
00203         /* Transmit -------------------------------------------------------- */
00204         _DBG_("Start Transmit...");
00205 
00206         /* Initialize buffer */
00207         Buffer_Init(1);
00208 
00209         /* Start I2C slave device first */
00210         transferSCfg.tx_data = Slave_Buf;
00211         transferSCfg.tx_length = sizeof(Slave_Buf);
00212         transferSCfg.rx_data = NULL;
00213         transferSCfg.rx_length = 0;
00214         I2C_SlaveTransferData(I2CDEV_S, &transferSCfg, I2C_TRANSFER_POLLING);
00215 
00216         _DBG_("Complete!");
00217 
00218 #if 1
00219         /* Receive and transmit -------------------------------------------------------- */
00220         _DBG_("Start Receive, wait for repeat start and transmit...");
00221 
00222         /* Initialize buffer */
00223         Buffer_Init(1);
00224         slave_test[0] = 0xAA;
00225         slave_test[1] = 0x55;
00226 
00227         /* Start I2C slave device first */
00228         transferSCfg.tx_data = Slave_Buf;
00229         transferSCfg.tx_length = sizeof(Slave_Buf);
00230         transferSCfg.rx_data = slave_test;
00231         transferSCfg.rx_length = sizeof(slave_test);
00232         I2C_SlaveTransferData(I2CDEV_S, &transferSCfg, I2C_TRANSFER_POLLING);
00233         _DBG_("Receive Data:");
00234         _DBH(slave_test[0]); _DBG_("");
00235         _DBH(slave_test[1]); _DBG_("");
00236         _DBG_("Complete!");
00237 #endif
00238 
00239 
00240     /* Loop forever */
00241     while(1);
00242     return 1;
00243 }
00244 
00245 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00246    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00247    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00248    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00249    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00250 int main(void)
00251 {
00252     return c_entry();
00253 }

00258 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00259 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00260 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00261 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00262 * @return               None
00263 *******************************************************************************/
00264 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00265 {
00266         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00267          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00268 
00269         /* Infinite loop */
00270         while(1);
00271 }
00272 #endif
